pr_title: Make the construction of alias abstractions immutable

timeline.message:
Make the construction of alias abstractions immutable
and change validation to be an implementation detail and
part of construction of the alias abstraction.

This change is part of series of changes to clean up the usage
IndexAbstraction.Alias in the codebase, so that it is no longer
needed to cast to IndexAbstraction.Alias and just use the methods
on the IndexAbstraction interface. This should help adding data
stream aliases, so that IndexAbstraction instances of type ALIAS
can also be data stream aliases.

Relates to #66163

timeline.bodyText: I didn't follow this case where the write index is set? It seems to me like it could incorrectly match the scenario when there is a single index for the alias but the index has not been specified as the write index for the alias.
timeline.author: danhermann

replies.bodyText: I was unaware of this logic too, but if an alias points to a single index then that index is always the write index even if it hasn't been marked as write index. I moved this logic from the computeAndValidateAliasProperties() method. I initially also wondered whether this if statement was needed, and didn't move it from the computeAndValidateAliasProperties() method, however many tests failed and after moving the if statement the build completed successfully.
replies.author: martijnvg

replies.bodyText: Ah, good to know. In that case, everything else LGTM.
